column4: I don't know who to inform about this.  But every time I try to download 9.10 desktop iso,  I get UNR instead.  I've done 64, and 32 bit.  Both go the respective UNR iso.
you have to get a library for that texturwe compression to work with open source graphic drivers
I assumed that it was a lib, but I have no idea which one, and when I search the repos, I can't find anything.
well the problem is that the texture compression tech is patented that's why linux distro can not enable it by default
the same happens with mp3 and a lot of other things that's why medibuntu exists
ok, so I need to find the right texture compression lib for the driver, wm, or app/engine?
is for the graphic driver /mesa/lidrm etc ...
if you use the propietary driver you will have no problem
Dr_Willis: I know that I could SIGSTOP it, but I still can't restart it and redirect the output (such as fg > /dev/tty1)
I wan't thinking, or I would have.
